meanings.sent1: In the library, there are many lexises filled with words.
meanings.sent2: The lexises on the bookshelves help students learn new words.
meanings.sent3: The lexises at the bookstore looked like a colorful rainbow of knowledge.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a vast lexises, containing endless words waiting to be discovered.
meanings.sent5: The lexises in her mind were like treasure chests full of linguistic gems.

meanings.definition: Lexises: a collection of words or phrases in a language
meanings.sent1: The lexises in the dictionary cover a wide range of vocabulary.
meanings.sent2: She enjoyed exploring different lexises to expand her language skills.
meanings.sent3: The lexises in the language app made learning feel like a fun game.
meanings.sent4: His speech was a rich tapestry woven from various lexises he had encountered.
meanings.sent5: The lexises of the foreign language seemed like a mysterious code waiting to be deciphered.
